thread.title: BP eyes upcoming oil auctions in Brazil, Mexico - Latam chief

title: BP eyes upcoming oil auctions in Brazil, Mexico - Latam chief
text:
April 30, 2018 / 8:51 PM / Updated 20 minutes ago BP eyes upcoming oil auctions in Brazil, Mexico - Latam chief Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
HOUSTON (Reuters) - Oil major BP ( BP.L ) is closely following oil auctions in Brazil and Mexico, which are expected to announce new awards later this year, to decide whether to submit bids aimed to expand its presence in the region, the firmâ€™s chief for Latin America, Felipe Arbelaez, said on Monday. FILE PHOTO: FILE PHOTO: The logo of BP is seen at a petrol station in Kloten, Switzerland October 3, 2017. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo/File Photo
Brazil will receive bids for blocks at its coveted presalt region in June and Mexico plans to announce results in September from two onshore rounds, including its first offer of unconventional areas for foreign investment.
Both countries will also hold presidential elections this year. Reporting by Marianna Parraga; editing by Diane Craft
